section.section: If there is more than one member of a class listed in subsection (a)(1), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), or (9) of this section entitled to make an anatomical gift, an anatomical gift may be made by a member of the class unless that member or a person to which the gift may pass under § 4-509 of this subtitle knows of an objection by another member of the class.
If an objection to an anatomical gift is known, the gift may be made only by a majority of the members of the class who are reasonably available.

text.section: A person may not make an anatomical gift if, at the time of the decedent's death, a person in a prior class under subsection (a) of this section is reasonably available to make or to object to the making of an anatomical gift.
